dt: {bc}having a defect or flaw {bc}imperfect in form, structure, or function
{bc}lacking one or more of the usual forms of inflection {dx_def}see {dxt|inflection||2}{/dx_def}

et: Middle English {it}defectif, defectyve{/it} "lacking, faulty, of poor quality," borrowed from Anglo-French {it}defectif,{/it} borrowed from Late Latin {it}dēfectīvus{/it} "lacking an inflectional form, imperfect, faulty," from Latin {it}dēfectus,{/it} past participle of {it}dēficere{/it} "to be lacking, run short, fail" + {it}-īvus{/it} {et_link|-ive|-ive} {ma}{mat|deficient|}{/ma}
shortdef: having a defect or flaw : imperfect in form, structure, or function
having a physical or mental impairment
lacking one or more of the usual forms of inflection

dt: {bc}something that is imperfect in form, structure, or function

dt.t: … if we examine 18 items off the production line, we may be interested in the number of {wi}defectives{/wi} we observe in the sample of size 18.

dt: {bc}a person having a physical or mental impairment

shortdef: something that is imperfect in form, structure, or function
a person having a physical or mental impairment
